heading: rants & raves
subheading: date: tue 10/10/2000 12:04 pm from: my musings (cwhanks@hotmail.com) to: newsfeedback@wired.com subject: netscape 6 ready for browsing i was one of those unfortunates who got totally screwed with netscape’s recent upgrade to the 4+ series (“netscape 6 ready for browsing,” oct. 5, 2000). before i transferred anything to 6, they were congratulating the hell out […]
author: wired blogs
text: date: tue 10/10/2000 12:04 pm from: my musings (cwhanks@hotmail.com)to: newsfeedback@wired.comsubject: netscape 6 ready for browsingi was one of those unfortunates who got totally screwed with netscape's recent upgrade to the 4+ series ("netscape 6 ready for browsing," oct. 5, 2000).before i transferred anything to 6, they were congratulating the hell out of themselves, and then lost all of my addresses, folders and files. they calmly ignored my requests and complaints with a corporate spirit that kept telling me how "happy" i should be at their "free" largess!netscape 6, 8, 80 – it doesn't make a bit of difference to me. i lost too much to ever trust this bunch of clowns ever again. let them feed on their complete bullshit and insensitivity. not even msn at its most arrogant is this stupid!
